title: Tax: All I-T Refunds To Be Credited Directly in Bank Accounts: CBDT
text:
Follow @mldigital 
The income-tax department has put in motion a new plan which will ensure that any refund on tax paid is safely deposited in the taxpayer’s personal bank account as soon as it is processed and released. The department is also planning to fully adopt and use banking services to end the current system of sending I-T refunds over the value of Rs50,000 via cheques through the postal department. CBDT chairperson, Anita Kapur, said the plan is being worked out on priority and is aimed at bringing an end to taxpayers’ grievances regarding this particular service. More in Moneylife
